name: Hill Track (Scrubland)
description: A sun-baked stretch of Hill Track, where scattered, scraggly mesquite trees offer meager shade from the relentless sun, a small mercy in the vast indifference of the desert. Hill Track continues its arduous journey to the north and south, a faint rutted path winding through sparse scrub and scattered rock formations. The air is still, thick with dust and the relentless heat, broken only by the distant caw of a crow and the endless hum of unseen insects, oblivious to the subtle grit of the west.
